meanings.definition: To write or carve words or symbols onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: She inscribes her name on the tree with a sharp rock.
meanings.sent2: The artist inscribes his signature at the bottom of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel inscribes 'I was here' on the park bench.
meanings.sent4: History inscribes the tales of ancient civilizations on ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The poet inscribes his emotions onto the blank page with careful strokes.

meanings.definition: To mark or engrave something onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: He inscribes a heart on the tree trunk as a symbol of love.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler inscribes intricate patterns on the silver bracelet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inscribes its paw prints on the freshly poured cement.
meanings.sent4: Time inscribes wrinkles on the face, telling stories of a life lived.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor inscribes his vision into the marble, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To dedicate or address a book or document to someone.
meanings.sent1: The author inscribes the novel to her loyal readers with gratitude.
meanings.sent2: The historian inscribes the historical document to the future generations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student inscribes a funny message on the textbook cover.
meanings.sent4: Love inscribes its name on the heart, forever etched in memory.
meanings.sent5: The calligrapher inscribes the wedding invitation with elegant script.
